api_providers.name: FRED
api_providers.data_coverage: Over 200,000 U.S. and international economic time series (GDP, CPI, unemployment, interest rates)

api_providers.name: World Bank
api_providers.data_coverage: Nearly 16,000 time series indicators from over 45 databases (WDI - GDP, GNI per capita, population, inflation, poverty)

api_providers.name: IMF
api_providers.data_coverage: Global financial stability, international trade, macroeconomic performance (WEO, IFS, Fiscal Monitor - GDP, exchange rates, CPI, balance of payments)
unique_features: DataMapper API for direct time series

api_providers.name: OECD
api_providers.data_coverage: High-quality, comparative statistics for member countries (national accounts, finance, employment, health, environment - unemployment, CPI)
unique_features: Proactive best practices guidance for caching

api_providers.name: ECB
api_providers.data_coverage: Monetary policy, financial stability, macroeconomic statistics for Euro area (policy interest rates, exchange rates, HICP inflation, GDP)
unique_features: Definitive source for Euro area data

api_providers.name: Bank of England
api_providers.data_coverage: UK-specific data (interest rates, exchange rates, money and credit, financial market data)

api_providers.name: BoJ (via Nasdaq Data Link)
api_providers.data_coverage: Japanese interest rates, money supply, TANKAN business survey, price indices, balance of payments (over 142,000 time-series)

api_providers.name: Stats NZ
api_providers.data_coverage: New Zealand statistics (CPI, FPI, labor market, GDP, population, international trade)

api_providers.name: DBnomics
api_providers.data_coverage: Over 1.2 billion time series from dozens of global and national institutions (IMF, Eurostat, ECB, OECD, BIS etc.)
unique_features: Time series alignment (NA values for gaps)

api_providers.name: EOD Historical Data (EODHD)
api_providers.documented_rate_limit: Free: 20 calls/day; Paid: 100,000+ calls/day (10 API calls per macro indicator request)
api_providers.data_coverage: Macro Indicators API (over 30 key indicators: GDP, inflation, unemployment, historical data back to 1960)
api_providers.developer_experience_rating: Standard REST API, paid tiers are viable

api_providers.name: Finnworlds
api_providers.data_coverage: Macroeconomic Data API (198 countries: GDP, CPI, interest rates), Economic Calendar API

api_providers.name: Financial Modeling Prep (FMP)
api_providers.data_coverage: Economic Indicators API (real-time and historical: GDP, unemployment, inflation)
api_providers.developer_experience_rating: Standard REST API, specific free plan limits not detailed

strategic_recommendations.general_architecture: Hybrid, multi-source data strategy to ensure resilience and leverage strengths of different provider types. Implement a robust caching layer for performance and to respect rate limits.

secondary_augmentations: Nasdaq Data Link's free BOJ feed (for Japan)
Low-cost commercial aggregator (e.g., EODHD) for specific gaps

primary_direct_connections: Bank of England's file download system (UK rates)
Bank of Japan feed via Nasdaq Data Link
currencies_interest_rates_dashboard_stac.secondary_commercial_aggregator: Finnworlds or EODHD (for obscure benchmark rates or smaller countries)

best_practices: Utilize client libraries for SDMX-based APIs (e.g., rdbnomics, OECD package, ecbdata)
Implement caching for rate-limited APIs (e.g., OECD data cached for 1 hour)
Develop file-parsing modules for legacy sources (e.g., Bank of England)
Account for API key requirements and authentication methods
Be aware of and design for documented and undocumented rate limits
